title: 🧬 What Is Precision Medicine — and Why It Matters

sections.heading: 🔍 What Is Precision Medicine?
sections.content: Precision medicine (also called personalized medicine) is a medical model that tailors treatment and prevention strategies to the unique characteristics of each patient. It draws on data from genomics, EHRs, lifestyle, and environmental factors to make treatment more accurate and effective.

sections.heading: 🧠 Why It Matters
content: Better Outcomes: More effective treatments with fewer side effects
Early Detection: Predictive models catch diseases before symptoms appear

sections.heading: 💡 Real‑World Examples
sections.content: From targeted cancer therapies to pharmacogenomics and AI-driven diabetes management — precision medicine is already reshaping care.

sections.heading: 🧬 The Role of Data Science
sections.content: Data science powers this transformation: integrating massive datasets, building predictive models, and visualizing results for clinicians. This is where my passion lies — using data to make healthcare smarter and more accessible.

sections.heading: 🌍 Looking Ahead
sections.content: In regions like Pakistan, limited access to genomic testing remains a challenge, but the rise of open datasets, wearable tech, and AI tools makes the future promising.
